title: Tringali Casanuova 2013 Renzo  (Bolgheri)
description: Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot come together to offer black currant and vanilla aromas in this dense Bolgheri red. The palate doles out ripe black plum and cedar-inflected tobacco flavors, set against fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2020.

title: Folonari 2013 Torcalvano  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Enticing blue flower, rose, new leather and graphite scents lead the nose. The vibrant if rather slender palate offers tart cherry, chopped herb and a saline note, framed by firm, fine-grained tannins.

title: Fetzer 2015 Echo Ridge Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: This is a medium-bodied, crisp and tangy wine with fresh parsley aromas and lemon and Granny Smith apple flavors. It's well balanced, restrained and will be very versatile with food.

title: Fattoria Del Cerro 2013 Antica Chiusina  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Packaged in an extremely heavy bottle, this has plum, toasted oak, new leather, dark spice and floral scents. The firm palate shows dried black cherry, roasted coffee, French oak and sage notes, while close-grained tannins grip the finish.

title: Fattoria di Grignano 2012 Poggio Gualtieri Riserva  (Chianti Rufina)
description: This blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot boasts ripe black-skinned fruit and cedar aromas. The concentrated palate delivers smoke-laced black plum and tobacco flavors held together by firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Fattoria La Vialla 2015 Casa Conforto  (Chianti Superiore)
description: Made of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo—organically farmed—this opens with violet and underbrush aromas. The palate delivers juicy red cherry and raspberry fruit, blanketed in smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Fattoria Lavacchio 2009 Ludiè  (Chianti Rufina)
description: Made entirely from organically farmed Sangiovese, this opens with mature black plum, resin and vanilla aromas. The palate is concentrated, delivering blackberry jam, tobacco and oak-driven spice over a firm tannic frame. Drink now–2020.

title: Fattoria Lavacchio 2011 Cedro Riserva  (Chianti Rufina)
description: The nose of this organically farmed Sangiovese (90%) and Merlot (10%) suggests ripe black plum and vanilla. On the palate, dried black cherry, licorice and cedar notes are bolstered by firm but chewy tannins. Drink through 2019.

title: Xanadu 2013 Exmoor Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)
description: This is a fine value in weeknight Cabernet, showing supple tannins, regionally distinct aromas and flavors of currants, sage and bay leaf, and subtle oak. Drink this fruit-driven, silky wine through 2020.

title: Yalumba 2016 The Y Series Unwooded Chardonnay (South Australia)
description: A solid effort at a bargain price makes this Chardonnay doubly appealing. It's medium bodied, delivering oodles of pineapple-tinged fruit and finishing clean and refreshing.

title: Zenith 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: It's rare to find estate-grown, Willamette Valley Pinot, from a vineyard in high demand, made by a top-tier winemaker, at this price. Still young, tight and tart, this is a very pretty wine, with tangy cherry fruit, a touch of rhubarb pie, and plenty of acidity. Another year or two of bottle age would be optimal.

title: Château Pipeau 2016 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Rounded and full of black fruits, this is already a gentle wine, with subtle tannins that lend just enough edge and structure to the bold fruit. It is a wine for medium-term aging, and will probably be ready to enjoy from 2022.

title: Château Plince 2014  Pomerol
description: The wine has bold fruit and ripe tannins. There is still a strong flavor from the wood aging although this should integrate. The fruit is the dominant character of this red-berry flavored wine. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Potensac 2016 Chapelle de Potensac Barrel Sample  (Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This wine's fruitiness is currently dominant, with attractive cherry tones that are bolstered by fine acidity. Soft, ripe and juicy, it is freshened by its crisp aftertaste. It will age well over the medium term.

title: Claiborne & Churchill 2015 Riesling (Central Coast)
description: Lemon zest and grapefruit aromas seemingly float atop the mineral-laden nose of this wine. It's full of crushed limestone and soda scents and is dry on the palate, which is more about structure and texture than overt flavors.

title: Colognole 2012  Chianti Rufina
description: Made of 95% Sangiovese and 5% Colorino, this opens with blue-flower fragrance and a whiff of thyme. The savory palate delivers juicy black cherry and white pepper notes, framed by fresh acidity and firm tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2015 Rosenberg Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: The nose of juicy plum promises ripe fruit. The palate follows with a generous softness. There is ease on this light body and lots of freshness. Enjoy while aromas are at their peak.

title: 3 Rings 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa Valley)
description: Despite it's considerable size, this silky wine is fresh and vibrant. Black currants and cherries lead the way, tinged with herbal notes suggestive of mint and lavender. Drink now–2020.

title: Andis 2014 Toy Vineyard Primitivo (Amador County)
description: This wine is fresh and fruity, full of raspberry and strawberry jam flavors that taste like they're straight from the crusher. Despite its full body, it's not a monster of a wine, feeling rather balanced, dry and well filled-out by flavor.

title: Avignonesi 2013  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: You'll find ripe berry, underbrush, leather, vanilla and grilled herb aromas in this bright, linear red. The palate is taut but medium-bodied, offering sour cherry, pomegranate and clove flavors tempered by firm acidity and grippy tannins. Give it a few years to unwind before drinking.

title: Canonica a Cerreto 2011 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: A blend of 90% Sangiovese, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot, this opens with violet and baking spice aromas. The dense palate delivers ripe black cherry, clove and cocoa flavors, with grippy tannins. Enjoy through 2020.

title: Carillon 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: This opens with dark-skinned berry, mocha and leather aromas. The palate is dense, suggesting red cherry, licorice and white pepper flavors, while close-grained tannins leave a grippy finish.

title: Castello di Poppiano 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Colli Fiorentini)
description: 85% Sangiovese is augmented with Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon in this Chianti, which offers mature black plum, white pepper and baking spice aromas. The lively palate delivers tart sour cherry, clove and underbrush notes, with a smoothly tannic structure. Enjoy through 2019.

title: Cathedral Ridge 2014 McDuffee Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (OR))
description: This shows good concentration with ample pear and peach fruit. Barrel aging in three-year-old American oak has somewhat softened the edges, and the wine finishes clean and fruity.

title: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2015 Collection Muscat (Alsace)
description: Damask rose and hints of dried orange make for a rather rich nose. These notions persist on the dry palate where an edge of bitterness creeps in. The finish is whistle clean and very fresh.

title: Centolani 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Earthy underbrush, sun-baked soil, chopped herb and new leather aromas lead the nose. The firm, lean palate offers dried cherry, crushed mint, clove and orange zest notes, pulled taut by tannins that grip the finish.

title: Château de Fonbel 2016 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This fruity wine offers soft tannins and crisp black-currant tones. It is spicy and bright, with plenty of acidity on the finish.

title: Château de Villambis 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: The low yields behind this wine have given it concentration as well as a firm tannic structure. It is dense and will take time for the fruit to shine. There are hints of the black-currant fruitiness that will arrive in time along with a crisp acidity. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Desmirail 2016 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This is a producer that needs to watch its wood. This is hugely toasty, and the oak suppresses the fruit.

title: Château Franc Mayne 2016 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This wine has a hard edge with a bitter character that comes from extraction. The producer needs to watch the wood because underneath, there is some delicious black fruit. The wine will take time and won't be ready before 2027.
